reasoning: Meningitis is an aggregate term covering bacterial, viral, and other etiologies with highly variable incidence globally. Global average approximately 8.5 per 100k person-years, with substantial geographic variation (low in developed countries ~1-3 per 100k, higher in sub-Saharan Africa ~10-25 per 100k). Uses incidence as meningitis typically involves acute presentation.
source: WHO Global Disease Burden Studies, summarizing multiple regional epidemiological surveys
